name: Version 1.5.3
body:
- Implementation of audio overlay filter (#199)
- Release BufferFilter's when renderer is released (#200)
- Allocate/deallocate native input/output buffers on init/release (#202)
- Add ability to reduce the target video's frame rate (#208) by @niekdev
- Add TransformationOptions flag to remove audio track(s) (#209) 
- Fix for incorrect bitrate extraction in size estimation (#212)
- Use source (or default) frame rate when creating video MediaFormat (#213) 
- Use null target MediaFormat for generic tracks (#214)

name: Version 1.5.2
body:
- Audio filter that changes track volume(https://github.com/linkedin/LiTr/pull/193)
- Fix ConcurrentModificationException when removing jobs (https://github.com/linkedin/LiTr/pull/195) by @ReallyVasiliy
- Notify TransformationListener before releasing TransformationJob (https://github.com/linkedin/LiTr/pull/198) by @simekadam

name: Version 1.5.1
body:
- Fix for incorrect orientation angle calculation during MVP matrix initialization (https://github.com/linkedin/LiTr/pull/185) by @kolesnikov-pasha
- AudioRenderer now picks correct AudioProcessor when audio format changes during transcoding (https://github.com/linkedin/LiTr/pull/190)

name: Version 1.5.0
body:
"Major" release because deprecated `transform` methods were removed in `MediaTransformer`

- Fix for error callback is not called with InsufficientDiskSpace exception (https://github.com/linkedin/LiTr/pull/179) by @mikeshuttjuvo
- Add new transform method that accepts output URI (https://github.com/linkedin/LiTr/pull/182)
- Support for transcoding video to VP8/VP9 (https://github.com/linkedin/LiTr/pull/183)
- Remove deprecated MediaTransformer methods (https://github.com/linkedin/LiTr/pull/184)

name: Version 1.4.19
body:
- Fix for missing documentation jar in release
- Fix for not yet started thumbnail jobs not being cleared when cancelled [#177](https://github.com/linkedin/LiTr/pull/177)

name: Version 1.4.18
body:
This release introduces a lot of audio processing improvements and fixes:

- A new AudioRenderer, focused solely on audio processing
- Capability to change sampling rate with high performance and high quality, provided by integrating [Oboe resampler](https://github.com/google/oboe/tree/master/src/flowgraph/resampler).
- Capability to mix stereo audio to mono and vice versa.
- Support for audio filters.
- Support for writing raw audio into WAV file.
- Fix for dropped audio frames.

name: Version 1.4.17
body:
- Allow non-negative reads from source buffer during transcoding [#133](https://github.com/linkedin/LiTr/pull/133)
- Fix GlVideoRenderer.hasFilters() logic [#135](https://github.com/linkedin/LiTr/pull/135)
- Obtain frame rate and interval from MediaFormat as either float or int [#138](https://github.com/linkedin/LiTr/pull/138)
- Do not set "profile" (MediaCodec.KEY_PROFILE) on the encoder [#139](https://github.com/linkedin/LiTr/pull/139)
- Add new target size estimation APIs to MediaTransformer [#155](https://github.com/linkedin/LiTr/pull/155)
- Fix for incorrect size estimation with range [#154](https://github.com/linkedin/LiTr/pull/154)
- New AudioRenderer implementation, with a render queue [#159](https://github.com/linkedin/LiTr/pull/159)
- Support for extracting a series of video thumbnails [#146](https://github.com/linkedin/LiTr/pull/146)

name: Version 1.4.16
body: - New `MockVideoMediaSource` and `PassthroughDecoder` implementations [#122](https://github.com/linkedin/LiTr/pull/122) which provide capability to create "empty" video

name: Version 1.4.15
body:
- Remove fallback codec lookup configuration flags [#114](https://github.com/linkedin/LiTr/pull/115)
- Bump dependencies
- Bump build tools and compile/target SDK levels to 30
- Enable Kotlin

name: Version 1.4.14
body:
## Version 1.4.14 (2021-04-20)

- Support for writing to Uri (by @Ma7moudHatem) [#114](https://github.com/linkedin/LiTr/pull/114)

name: Version 1.4.13
body: - Support for reducing audio sampling rate (by @Ma7moudHatem) [#111](https://github.com/linkedin/LiTr/pull/111)

name: Version 1.4.12
body: - Enhance the logic for finding a media codec for a media format (by @Ma7moudHatem) [#109](https://github.com/linkedin/LiTr/pull/109)

name: Version 1.4.11
body:
## Version 1.4.11 (2021-03-17)

- Release unused anymore MediaMetadataRetriever instance (by @Ma7moudHatem) [#106](https://github.com/linkedin/LiTr/pull/106)
- Make the default FRAME_WAIT_TIMEOUT equals to zero, because on some device the previous value cause a very very long processing time (by @Ma7moudHatem) [#105](https://github.com/linkedin/LiTr/pull/105)
- Fix a DivideByZero exception when track duration is shorter than 1 sec (by @Ma7moudHatem) [#104](https://github.com/linkedin/LiTr/pull/104)

name: Version 1.4.10
body:
## Version 1.4.10 (2021-03-14)

- Fix renderFrame logic in PassthroughSoftwareRenderer (by @Ma7moudHatem) [#103](https://github.com/linkedin/LiTr/pull/103)

name: Version 1.4.9
body:
## Version 1.4.9 (2021-02-26)

- Fix the fallbackToGetCodecByType logic (by @Ma7moudHatem) [#98](https://github.com/linkedin/LiTr/pull/98)

name: Version 1.4.8
body: - Moved artifact publishing from JCenter to Maven Central [#95](https://github.com/linkedin/LiTr/pull/95)

name: Version 1.4.7
body: Get MediaCodec by type as a fallback to getting MediaCodec by config, instead of using it as a replacement.

name: Version 1.4.7 beta 1
body: Falling back to getting MediaCodec by type when getting by config fails, instead of getting by type as an alternative.

name: Version 1.4.6
body: Fix for audio transcoding failing on some older devices due to negative frame presentation time.

name: Version 1.4.5
body:
- "Mid-Level" `transform` method that takes custom component implementations is now deprecated. Clients should use `transform(List<TrackTransform>)` method instead.
- Trim performance improvement - seeking to trim start now works. Special thanks to @NiekAkerboom for reporting!
- New fallback method by @luix for `MediaCodec` not being found on some devices. 
- Ability to force using older (but seemingly more reliable) method to get `MediaCodec` by name, instead of newer (and recommended by Google) way to get it by `MediaFormat`. Special thanks to @khoben for reporting this!

name: Version 1.4.4
body: Support for video/audio trimming

name: Version 1.4.4 beta 1
body:
Support for trimming media.
Fixed version number

name: Version 1.4.4 beta 0
body: Support for media trimming

name: Version 1.4.3
body: - Added Local Binary Pattern (LBP) filter

name: Version 1.4.2
body: - Preview rendered provides `SurfaceTexture` in the call, for greater implementation flexibility (using with camera preview, for example)

name: Version 1.4.1
body:
- Rework of filter initialization: GL initialization and VP matrix configuration are split into separate methods
- Added `release` method to clean up GL resources used by a filter
- Video filter preview functionality

name: Version 1.4.0
body:
- Major refactor of frame render filters.
- New `VideoFrameRenderFilter`, which supports parametrized creation of custom frame render filters by passing in custom vertex and fragment shaders in the constructor, along with names and values of uniforms used in those shaders. Current vertex and fragment shaders are available as a default.
- 40 new pixel effect (brightness, contrast, hue, saturation, exposure, color adjustment, blur, etc.) filters, ported from [Mp4Composer-android](https://github.com/MasayukiSuda/Mp4Composer-android) and [android-gpuimage](https://github.com/cats-oss/android-gpuimage) projects.
- Geometric transformation used for positioning video frame and bitmap overlays is now a separate `Transform` class, instead of several individual method parameters.
- New utility which queries for highest supported codec profile.
- Bugfixes

name: Version 1.3.2
body:
- New PassthroughSoftwareRenderer, used to render audio frames
- Capability to use custom fragment shaders in GlVideoRenderer, by @tguerin 
- First custom fragment shader - grayscale conversion, by @tguerin

name: Version 1.3.1
body:
- Fixing a bug when input surface's texture matrix was not correctly set by renderer and subsequently incorrectly used by filters.
- Now using texture matrix for correct orientation in bitmap filters as well, similar to video filters
- Cleanup, refactoring, adding missing copyright notices.

name: Version 1.3.0
body:
This version provides an ability to override how source video frame is rendered onto target video frame:
 - by default, current "scale to fit" behavior is maintained, by introducing ScaleToFitGlFrameRenderFilter
 - GlFrameRender interface is introduced for filters that need access to source video frame texture handle
 - by default, target video background is black
 
Two new filters are now available in filter pack library:
 - FreeTransformFrameRenderFilter, which supports geometric transformation (scaling, rotation, translation) of source video frame. 
 - SolidBackgroundColorFilter, which supports changing background color of a target video.

name: Version 1.2.5
body: Fix for MarshallingHandler not using client provided Looper (by @cyrilmottier)

name: Version 1.2.4
body: Correctly handling tracks with no duration.

name: Version 1.2.3
body: Ability to invoke listener callbacks on a non-UI transformation thread.

name: Version 1.2.2
body: - Fixing version in build files and README.md

name: Version 1.2.1
body:
- Defaulting encoder format color to COLOR_FormatSurface
- New MediaTransformer constructor, which allows passing in Looper and ExecutionService
- New MockMediaTransformer class to be used in UI tests

name: Version 1.2.0
body:
- Support for track based operations: including/excluding tracks, muxing/demuxing tracks, different transformations for different tracks, etc.

- Allowing passing null video target format. When overlays are not present, video track will be untouched. When overlays are present, video track will be transcoded with resolution/bitrate of source video and overlay will be applied. 

- Generalizing renderer interface.

name: Version 1.1.1
body: Fix in vertical scaling logic for bitmap/animation overlays.

name: Version 1.1.0
body:
Changes in litr:
 - GlRenderer now expects target video aspect ratio when being initialized
 - GlVideoRenderer now sets up orthogonal projection matrix (adjusted for aspect ratio), in addition to view matrix adjusted for video rotation. Both matrices are multiplied to form a PV matrix and passed into filters. 

Changes in litr-filters:
 - Bitmap overlays now use PV matrix to correctly scale, rotate and translate bitmap/animation overlays.
